Sample ID.definition: The researcher generated unique ID of the sample collected.

Animal ID.definition: The researcher generated unique ID of the individual animal from which the sample was collected.

Host species.definition: (Required) The species of the animal from which the sample was collected, written using binomial nomenclature, e.g. 'Vicugna pacos'

Host NCBI tax ID.definition: The NCBI taxonomic ID of the host species, if known. Must be numeric, 1-7 digits long, e.g. '30538'

Latitude.definition: (Required) The north south position of a collection site, written in form '00.00000' with 5 decimal places.

Longitude.definition: (Required) The east west position of a collection site, written in form '00.00000' with 5 decimal places.

Collection day.definition: (Required) The day of the month on which the speciman was collected. If unknown, use '1' for the first day of the month.

Collection month.definition: (Required) The month in which the speciman was collected, in numeric form. E.g. type '12' for December.

Collection year.definition: (Required) The year in which the speciman was collected. Type as four digits, e.g. '2021'

Collection method or tissue.definition: The technique used to extract the sample, e.g. 'oropharyngeal swab', or the tissue from which the sample was extracted.

Detection method.definition: The type of test performed to detect the pathogen, e.g. 'conventional PCR'

Detection target.definition: The pathogen or category of pathogens a detection method is designed to identify. This should reflect methodology over study aim (e.g., a visual inspection for ticks might still recover fleas and could be reported as targeting 'Ectoparasites').

Detection outcome.definition: (Required) The result of the test performed. Must be one of the following: 'positive' or 'negative' or 'inconclusive'

Pathogen.definition: (Required) The pathogen detected by the test, if any, e.g. 'SARS-CoV-2' (may be different from the detection target). If no pathogen detected, enter 'none'.

Pathogen NCBI tax ID.definition: The NCBI taxonomic ID of the pathogen detected, if known. Must be numeric, 1-7 digits long, e.g. '2697049'.

Organism sex.definition: The sex of the inidividual animal from which the sample was collected. Must be one of the following: 'female' or 'male' or 'unknown'

Dead or alive.definition: The state of the individual animal from which the sample was collected, at the time of sample collection. Must be one of the following: 'dead' or 'alive' or 'unknown'

Health notes.definition: Any additional notes about the state of the animal at the time of sample collection.

Age.definition: The numeric age of the animal from which the sample was collected, at the time of sample collection, together with the column 'age units'

Age units.definition: The units that correspond to the number entered in the column 'age'. Units must be one of the following: 'years' or 'months' or 'days'

Mass.definition: The numeric mass of the animal from which the sample was collected, at the time of sample collection, together with the column 'mass units'

Mass units.definition: The units that correspond to the number entered in the column 'mass'. Units must be one of the following: 'tons' or 'lb' or 'kg' or 'g' or 'oz'

Length.definition: The numeric length of the animal from which the sample was collected, at the time of sample collection, together with the column 'length units'

Length units.definition: The units that correspond to the number entered in the column 'length'. Units must be one of the following: 'ft' or 'in' or 'm' or 'cm' or 'mm'
